Meander through the gardens and enjoy a tropical escape in the heart of Miami Beach. Located next to the Miami Beach Convention Center, the garden is part of the Miami Beach City Center Campus in the Miami Beach Convention Center district. Botanical Garden Activities Take a break from the hustle and bustle of South Beach to enjoy the beauty of stunning orchids, the tranquility of the Japanese Garden and the beautiful koi pond. Miami Beach Botanical Garden has several distinct garden areas to explore. Highlights include spotting orchids in the trees and along the ground, marveling at the garden’s largest and oldest palms in its northeast corner, and breathing in the sweet scent of the ylang-ylang tree. The garden offers yoga classes, cultural events, workshops and other activities throughout the year. Some activities are currently held virtually, but there are still events taking place at the garden. Be sure to check the website for more details. If you’re looking to rent an event space , the Miami Beach Botanical Garden offers spaces for weddings and more. Botanical Garden Tours The garden has adjusted its tour hours. Please visit the ticketing page for details about how to purchase tickets and schedule tours. Self-guided audio tours (available in English, Spanish and Portuguese) are available. A garden map is accessible at the main entrance and welcome center. Botanical Boutique & Garden Center Grow your own piece of Miami with seeds and orchids from the Botanical Boutique. You can nab some unique souvenirs here such as items created by local artisans, jewelry and even compost soil made in the garden. At the Garden Center, you can get a peek at what the garden is currently growing. A nursery, propagation center and outdoor classroom make the garden center a great stop for budding plant enthusiasts. Talk to one of the garden’s horticulturalists for information about plants and professional tips on making your plants thrive. Visiting the Garden Thanks to Miami’s subtropical climate, the garden is open year-round and many plants flower continuously. Hours are currently limited and you must purchase timed-entry tickets ahead of time to visit. Check the Miami Botanical Garden to purchase tickets and for information about prices, hours and amenity availability, as well as event and garden rental information. General Amenities Free Wifi Self-Parking Number of Self-Parking Spaces: 10 Pet Friendly Gift Shop Meeting/Private Event Space Smoke-Free Property The Miami Beach Botanical Garden is a three acres tropical oasis located directly across from the City’s state of the art Convention Center and just two blocks from the famed Lincoln Road open air pedestrian mall. The Garden provides visitors a unique opportunity to view our horticulture collections. Designed with meandering walkways, water features, specialty gardens, a 5000 square feet Great Lawn and a 350 ft. waterfront promenade, this is the perfect location for corporate meetings or social gatherings. The garden provides amble space for interacting while observing social distancing protocols. The Garden offers two meeting function rooms. The Banyan Ballroom opens out to a covered terrace with views into the garden. This room, with its 18 ft ceiling, is coded to accommodate up to 110 people with an additional 90 guests on the adjacent terrace. The Butterfly Conference Room, equipped with large screen monitor and easy A/V hook up, is ideal for a group of 40 or less Free wifi is available throughout the property. Visit the website at www.mbgarden.org. For event information contact Maurice Jackson at maurice@mbgarden.org or call at 305 673 7256 x 2020. Our garden is a unique, subtropical oasis of beauty and tranquility within an urban setting—a community resource that refreshes, inspires and engages our visitors. Overview This is a skilled position with the Miami Beach Garden Conservancy which is responsible for the preventative care, formative pruning, planting and removal of trees and shrubs to improve appearance, maintain usability, improve plant health and minimize storm damage. Arborists can see the impact their work has on the Miami Beach Botanical Garden landscape/environment that will benefit the community for years to come, along with the impact it will have on the residents. This position is well suited for those looking to work as a team, primarily outdoors. This position offers both part-time and full-time opportunities, with flexible scheduling based on availability and preference. The ideal candidate will have a passion for horticulture, a strong work ethic, and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team to maintain the beauty of our garden. Pay Rate 2025 starting hourly rate is $30.00/hr with advancement to $35.00/hr. The Miami Beach Garden Conservancy offers a suite of benefits to all full-time employees including paid holidays, time off, health, dental and vision insurance.  The Garden pays 100% of employee premiums for health insurance.  After 1 year of service the Garden also offers a 4% match on its 401(k) plan. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES The work below is representative of the scope of work performed. Individual duties will vary based on work assignment. Tree & plant installation, maintenance and care Plant, prune and provide general care of trees and shrubs. Operate hand and power tools, saws, light and medium duty equipment, and various other grounds & tree maintenance equipment. Plant trees and other plant material according to current applicable industry standards. Inspect trees and shrubs to determine health and perform integrated pest management. Train laborers and volunteers in the techniques and procedures of planting, pruning and general care of trees and shrubs. Respond to storm events and any resulting damage, which may include coordination of work with contractors. Perform general custodial duties including leaf blowing, sweeping, general cleaning, waste & rubbish removal. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Education and Experience Associate’s degree or two-year vocational certificate in horticulture, arboriculture, landscape maintenance, natural resources, ecology or closely related field AND two (2) years of experience performing preventative care, formative pruning, and tree removal OR an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job. Desirable Qualifications Experience in public gardening and arboriculture with related knowledge of general tree and plant identification, pruning and grounds maintenance. If this work interests you but you are unsure if you meet all the job requirements listed above, please apply anyway! Your experience is likely more applicable to the role than you think, and the Miami Beach Garden Conservancy is interested in candidates who can bring not only technical expertise but a variety of lived experience to the team. PHYSICAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL CRITERIA In consideration of the overall amount of physical effort required to perform this position, the work is best described as Heavy Work: Exerting up to 100 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 50 pounds of force frequently, and/or up to 20 pounds of force constantly to move objects.  Working in extreme heat (above 100 degrees) and rain is expected.  An ability to walk on uneven ground (gravel, rocks, mounds) is expected. To have your application considered in the first round of reviews, please apply before September 8, 2025.  Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. How to Apply : Interested candidates can send a resume or brief description of experience to kathy@mbgarden.org Job Description: Part-Time or Full-Time Gardener – Miami Beach Botanical Garden Location : Miami Beach, FL Position : Part-Time or Full-Time Gardener Compensation : Competitive pay, based on experience Overview : The Miami Beach Botanical Garden is seeking a reliable and dedicated Gardener to join our team. This position offers both part-time and full-time opportunities, with flexible scheduling based on availability and preference. The ideal candidate will have a passion for horticulture, a strong work ethic, and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team to maintain the beauty of our garden. Responsibilities : Maintain and care for a wide variety of plants, flowers, trees, and landscaping features throughout the garden. Assist in planting, pruning, weeding, mulching, and general garden maintenance. Water plants and monitor soil health to ensure optimal growth conditions. Keep garden areas clean and tidy, including trash removal and sweeping. Assist with pest control, disease management, and applying fertilizers as needed. Maintain garden tools and equipment, ensuring they are clean and in good working condition. Assist with educational and community outreach events held within the garden. Help with the setup and breakdown of garden events as needed. Qualifications : Previous experience in gardening, landscaping, or horticulture is preferred but not required. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Strong attention to detail and a love for plants and nature. Must be able to lift heavy objects (up to 50 lbs) and perform physical tasks such as bending, kneeling, and standing for long periods. Ability to work outdoors in varying weather conditions. Strong communication skills and a positive attitude. A valid driver’s license may be required for transportation of materials, depending on the position. Physical Requirements : Ability to lift and carry items weighing up to 50 pounds. Ability to bend, kneel, and work in various physical positions. Comfortable working in all weather conditions, including sun and rain. Benefits : Competitive hourly wage. Flexible work schedule (part-time or full-time). Opportunity to work in a beautiful, vibrant environment. All fees must be paid prior to the beginning of the photo/filming session upon arrival of the crew. Meander through the gardens and enjoy a tropical escape in the heart of Miami Beach. Located next to the Miami Beach Convention Center, the garden is part of the Miami Beach City Center Campus in the Miami Beach Convention Center district. Botanical Garden Activities Take a break from the hustle and bustle of South Beach to enjoy the beauty of stunning orchids, the tranquility of the Japanese Garden and the beautiful koi pond. Miami Beach Botanical Garden has several distinct garden areas to explore. Highlights include spotting orchids in the trees and along the ground, marveling at the garden’s largest and oldest palms in its northeast corner, and breathing in the sweet scent of the ylang-ylang tree. The garden offers yoga classes, cultural events, workshops and other activities throughout the year. Some activities are currently held virtually, but there are still events taking place at the garden. Be sure to check the website for more details. If you’re looking to rent an event space , the Miami Beach Botanical Garden offers spaces for weddings and more. Botanical Garden Tours The garden has adjusted its tour hours. Please visit the ticketing page for details about how to purchase tickets and schedule tours. Self-guided audio tours (available in English, Spanish and Portuguese) are available. A garden map is accessible at the main entrance and welcome center. Botanical Boutique & Garden Center Grow your own piece of Miami with seeds and orchids from the Botanical Boutique. You can nab some unique souvenirs here such as items created by local artisans, jewelry and even compost soil made in the garden. At the Garden Center, you can get a peek at what the garden is currently growing. A nursery, propagation center and outdoor classroom make the garden center a great stop for budding plant enthusiasts. Talk to one of the garden’s horticulturalists for information about plants and professional tips on making your plants thrive. Visiting the Garden Thanks to Miami’s subtropical climate, the garden is open year-round and many plants flower continuously. Hours are currently limited and you must purchase timed-entry tickets ahead of time to visit. Check the Miami Botanical Garden to purchase tickets and for information about prices, hours and amenity availability, as well as event and garden rental information. Table of Contents Take a break from the South Beach hustle and bustle to enjoy the wonders of nature at the Miami Beach Botanical Garden. Here you can find tranquility throughout the distinct garden areas to explore. Bring the family to enjoy the activities and events throughout the year. About Miami Beach Botanical Garden The City of Miami Beach created the Garden Center in 1962 opposite the Miami Beach Convention Center. At the time, it was a City Park and the garden situated on the Collins Canal. In 1996 a group of Miami Beach residents approached the City Council to create the Miami Beach Botanical Garden Conservancy. It is a non-profit organization that has a mission to restore the gardens. Today it is a public-to-private partnership place owned by the City of Miami Beach. It is a dynamic venue that presents a guided garden and self-guided audio tours and has arts and cultural programs with cultural tours and environmental education for all. Things To Know Before Going To Miami Beach Botanical Garden When visiting the Miami Beach Botanical Garden, general admission is free, so you can easily spend the day with the family at this fabulous place. Still, there are a few things visitors need to know to plan a visit to the Miami Gardens. Hours and Days of Operation The botanical garden, garden center, and Botanical Boutique are open from Tuesday to Sunday at 9 am and close at 5 pm. The garden is closed to visitors on the 4th of July, Thanksgiving, Christmas Day, and New Year’s Day. Admission and Tickets Admission to the garden is free, but fees are payable when particular events occur. You can find metered parking along 19th Street, a parking lot between Meridian Avenue and Convention Center Drive, with standard rates applied. There are parking garages on 17th and 18th Streets with an hourly rate. The hourly rate is $4 for street parking and surface parking lots. The parking garages cost $2 per hour, and you pay $1 per hour for registered Miami residents. To plan your visit, you can download the garden map to follow the routes when you visit the Miami Beach Botanical Garden. Photography Policy You can take souvenir snapshots, commercial photography, personal portraits, and film shoots. All fees must be paid before the photo/filming sessions. For individual shots used for personal photography, weddings, and groups of six people, you need not make reservations, but it helps to call in advance. The rate is $150 per hour, and no dressing rooms are available. You need permits and a reservation for all other photo sessions to film. For these sessions, you can reserve an air-conditioned dressing room in advance. Pets The only pets allowed are service animals for the disabled. Contact Details The Miami Botanical Garden is situated at 2000 Convention Center Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139, and the contact details are 305.673.PALM (7256). Things To See Inside Miami Beach Botanical Garden Enjoy a relaxing family day at this South Beach facility with plenty to do and see. Japanese Garden You can enjoy the cascading waters in the Zen garden at the Japanese Garden, showcasing collections of different bamboo specimens. A small red bridge crosses two pools rippling over the river rock. Here you can see later pagodas to many other fabulous things. Another great thing is gathering in small groups for photo ops and ceremonies. Edible Garden See the garden’s beauty to see vegetation used in culinary from around the world. The garden contains: Papaya (Carica papaya) Pineapples (Ananas comosus) Pomegranates (Punica granatum) Coffee (Coffea arabica) The common fig (Ficus carica) Jaboticaba (Plinia cauliflora) Brazilian cherry (Eugenia brasiliensis) Macadamia tree (Macadamia ternifolia) Starfruit tree (Averrhoa carambola) Lychee tree (Litchi chinensis) The fantastic thing is that the botanic garden harvests its own food, from fresh herbs and veg/fruit for mixers and events to workshops. You can find the seeds for sale at the gift shop. Orchid Garden In the plant kingdom, orchids are one of the largest flowering families, and each is unique. Explore the Orchid Garden to see how this magnificent plant thrives in the humid climate of South Florida. The orchid remains part of the exotic plants found in the world. Flowering Trees Smell the intoxicating Ylang-ylang tree as you enter the garden. Another tree with an exotic smell is the Frangipani and native Florida plants outdoors like the Fiddlewood. Behind the executive office, you find the White Scented Garden you should not miss. Native Garden Here you have a wild area defined by woodchipped pathways, and densely planted tropical plants, trees, palms to shrubs. The corky stem attracts the state’s butterflies, and you see a lot of water conservation for wildlife in the garden. Palm Garden A symbol of the tropics is the palm tree found throughout Miami Beach. In the Palm Garden. Here you can find over 100 species growing in this section, providing beautiful spaces for you to explore. Water Show The Miami Beach Botanical Garden is a water display with water features found everywhere. You have the refurbished circular fountain outside the offices with the main pond to cascading polite fountain with water lilies. Collins Canal Prominade At the Collins Canal Promenade, you find a walkway with a 352-foot waterfront that flows into the gardens from the northern perimeter. Here you find a shaded area of plans with other trees and wildflowers that attract pollinators. With the pathway, you get access to the iconic cultural institutions of Miami Beach. Wildlife The Miami Beach Botanical Garden is a sanctuary for different wildlife found in the urban area. You see different birds passing through with some permanent residents, like hawks, herons, and egrets. There are a lot of butterflies to moths feeding on the nectar of plants. Even the bird feeders you find displayed in the view. See turtles residing in the ponds to cichlid and koi fish. Rental And Other Interesting Things at The Botanical Garden You will find a nursery with a propagation center to outdoor classrooms at the garden center. You can discuss the right indoor plant to grow in your garden with the experts or pick up a bag of compost. The Botanical Boutique is a lovely little gift shop with jewelry and garden seeds for gift ideas for garden lovers. Here you find gardening tools to other equipment to use at home. Whether it is a t-shirt, baseball cap, or reusable water bottle, you can find it here. While you do not find any eateries inside the garden, you can find a restaurant or snack stand outside the vicinity to enjoy cold drinks and more. Still, you can host an event or visit some of the events. A highlight, except for seeing native plants, paved walkways, and the holocaust memorial, you take yoga classes on a Sunday. Vending machines are also available, but you cannot rent motorized wheelchairs. Still, with the beautiful spaces, and so many butterflies, you can hold a wedding there. Host an event at the canopied terrace with a breathtaking setting and beautiful plants. It is a charming place to watch the sunset. You can also find a small garden to host other events. Frequently Asked Questions Can you picnic at the Miami Beach Botanical Garden? There is a pool area, but food is not allowed within the Miami Beach Botanical Gardens. Are dogs allowed in Miami Beach Botanical Garden? No pets are allowed, only service dogs for the disabled. Is there a Miami Beach Botanical Garden tour? The Miami Beach Botanical Garden hosts tours, and you can find out more about them on their tour page. There are also self-guided tours with audio in different languages and a map available. There are two entrances, but the map you find at the main entrance. Do you get a Miami Beach Botanical Garden Membership? You can get a membership card at the Miami Beach Botanical Garden, providing you with discounts to gift shop items and events. You also get free magazine subscriptions. Miami Beach Botanical Garden | Give Miami Day Search Log in Miami Beach Botanical Garden A nonprofit organization Donate Fundraise Share this organization 0% complete $62,000 Goal The Miami Beach Botanical Garden is a serene 3-acre urban oasis, tucked away from the glitz of South Beach. It's a slice of paradise where residents and visitors can commune with nature. The Garden is a living museum that serves as a destination for the public, inviting both young and old, from around the corner or around the world, to view our diverse subtropical collection of rare palm species, orchids and cycads.  The Garden's habitat hosts wildlife including butterflies, migrating birds, fish and turtles. Visiting children especially love chasing the butterflies and feeding the fish. We strive to be a fountainhead of sustainability by offering green living education. We encourage the public to reduce their carbon footprint by participating in our compost initiative where their food scraps are processed into nutrient rich soil. We maintain an apiary to help educate our visitors about the importance of plant pollination. We are firmly committed to minimizing the use of commercial fertilizers that directly impact everyone's water supplies. Educational horticulture seminars and workshops are offered monthly, teaching botanical best practices to all levels of garden lovers, and our annual Earth Day Celebration provides a platform with other environmental nonprofits who want to share their messages. The Garden is a mecca for the cultural arts, serving as a stage for visual and performing artists. A schedule of live musical performances, as well as a monthly rotation of art exhibitions and collaborative programming with other dance, film and art organizations brings a wide audience to experience the beauty of nature in the heart of Miami Beach. The generous support received during Give Miami Day is essential to delivering on our mission. Mission The mission of the Miami Beach Botanical Garden is to promote environmental enjoyment, stewardship and sustainability through education, the arts, and interaction with the natural world. Our garden is a unique, subtropical oasis of beauty and tranquility within an urban setting-a community resource that refreshes, inspires and engages our visitors.
